intro: Leandra variabilis var. longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled leandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with long petioles that distinguish this variant from others in the species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
